moves.1. e4 e5 2. c4: Unusual move, not a bad one - White transposes into a english structure.
moves.2... Nc6: Black prepares to dominate the d4 hole.
moves.5. Nc3: White's control of d5 makes up for the weakness at d4 for now.
moves.5... d6 6. d3 Nf6: No rush to open the position by f5
moves.7. h3 h6 8. Qe2 O-O 9. Be3 Be6 10. Bxc5: This allows black greater control of d4.
moves.10... dxc5 11. Nd5 Nd7: Strong move - black plans to rid himself of a weakness at d5 by playing c6 thus forcing the knight to retreat with loss of time.
moves.12. g4 Nd4 13. Nxd4 cxd4: Black rids himself of double pawns.
moves.14. h4 c6 15. g5: Attempt of counter play on the kingside
moves.15... hxg5: cxd5 cxd5 and black does not win a piece.
moves.16. Nc7: White tries to gain a tempo for his kingside attack.
moves.16... Qxc7 17. hxg5 g6: Black stalls the queen rook battery on the h-file.
moves.18. f4 Kg7: preparing to meet Qh2 by Rh8 stoping white from using the h-file.
moves.19. Qh2 Rfh8 20. Qg1 Rxh1 21. Qxh1 Rh8 2: Gaining e5 as a outpost for the knight.
moves.24. Qf2 f3: A useful waiting move b5 was also playable.
moves.25... c5 26. Qc3 Rh2: The rook is strong on the 2nd rank.
moves.27. d4 cxd4: Black exposes a weakness on c4.
moves.28. Rxd4 Rh1 29. Rd1 Kg8: Unpinning the Knight now every piece is involed in the attack.
